p: Xiao Qian Wang (Westmead Institute for Medical Research, Westmead, Australia) presented data on the clinical correlates of intact HIV-1 provirus isolated from circulating CD4 T cells of ART-naïve HIV/HBV co-infected ( n=19) and HIV-1 mono-infected ( n=4) individuals recruited in Thailand. A higher level of intact HIV-1 proviruses, analysed using the full-length individual proviral sequencing, FLIP assay, [21]) was found in both co-infected (7–80%) and mono-infected (23–59%) individuals compared to prior studies. However, both groups had proviruses with comparable genetic diversity.
